content.question: In the Dominican Republic in August, the distribution of daily high temperature is approximately normal with mean 86 degrees Fahrenheit (<math alttext="degrees F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>°</mi><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>). Approximately 95% of all daily high temperatures are between <math alttext="83 degrees Fahrenheit" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>83</mn><mi>°</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="89 degrees Fahrenheit" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>89</mn><mi>°</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the standard deviation of the distribution?

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
